message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. Given its value to us, we're looking to sell it for $14,000. We believe this price reflects its quality and potential benefits to you. Let me know if this offer suits your budget.

Thanks for the offer Alice, but $14,000 is a bit more than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to pay $12,500 for the product. This is a fair price considering my budget and the value I place on the product.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to meet halfway. Considering the value of the product and your budget, I am willing to negotiate further. My counteroffer is $13,500 for the product. I hope this aligns better with your financial considerations.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $13,500 is still a bit high for me. Given my budget, I can only offer $12,800. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and my financial constraints.  I'm hoping we can reach an agreement.

I understand your position, Bob, and I'm glad we're finding common ground. In light of your offer, I propose a counteroffer of $13,000 for the product. This is a slight increase from my previous proposal, aiming to ensure both parties are satisfied with the transaction. I hope this meets your expectations.

Alice, I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still struggling to reach $13,000. To finalize this deal, I'm offering $12,900. This is a small increase from my previous offer and shows my commitment to acquiring the product. I hope we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. In order to close this deal, I'm willing to accept $12,950 for the product. This is the highest price I can go, considering the value of the product to me. I believe this offers a fair compromise between our positions.
